Bouncing boomerang visualised with line drawing.

Boomerang

The Boomerang utilizes a reflection formula to determine which way to bounce after coliding with a surface.

The visualisation works using the same formula but instead of checking the boomerangs operlapping, it instead uses a "LineTrace" that returns the neccessarry information, that is then used to draw the debug lines.

Gif showcases two particle systems being spawned ontop of eachother.

Particle System

Spawns multiple particles, gives them random offsets and scales them based on a "Bouncing" cubic easing function.

The particle updating and rendering is completely seperated from the actor class to make it as lightweight as possible.

Level Editor

The level editor has a toggleable background grid, the ability to save and load levels from .csv files, select and place different actors such as enemies and blocks, I am currently developing a spline system that will work as an attachment rail for the camera.

Spline tool showcase.

Spline Tool

The Spline is being used as a camera rail which the user sets up when building their level. If the player gets within a certain radius the camera attaches to the rail.

It visualizes curves and points along the path, a "get_closest_point_on_spline" function calculates the nearest point on the spline based on a given position. The spline could easily be repurposed for different use cases if wanted.
